001package com.deploygate.sdk;
002
003import android.app.Application;
004import android.content.BroadcastReceiver;
005import android.content.ComponentName;
006import android.content.Context;
007import android.content.Intent;
008import android.content.IntentFilter;
009import android.content.ServiceConnection;
010import android.os.Build;
011import android.os.Bundle;
012import android.os.Handler;
013import android.os.IBinder;
014import android.os.RemoteException;
015import android.text.TextUtils;
016import android.util.Log;
017
018import com.deploygate.sdk.internal.Logger;
019import com.deploygate.sdk.internal.VisibilityLifecycleCallbacks;
020import com.deploygate.service.DeployGateEvent;
021import com.deploygate.service.IDeployGateSdkService;
022import com.deploygate.service.IDeployGateSdkServiceCallback;
023
024import java.util.HashMap;
025import java.util.HashSet;
026import java.util.Iterator;
027import java.util.LinkedList;
028import java.util.Map;
029import java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch;
030import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
031
032/**
033 * This is DeployGate SDK library. Import this library to the application
034 * package and call {@link #install(Application)} on the onCreate() of
035 * application class to enable crash reporting and application launch
036 * notification.
037 * <p>
038 * In order to get working Remote LogCat feature, you also have to add
039 * <code>&lt;uses-permission android:name="android.permission.READ_LOGS" /&gt;</code>
040 * in AndroidManifest.xml of your application.
041 * </p>
042 *
043 * @author tnj
044 */
045public class DeployGate {
046    private static final String TAG = "DeployGate";
047
048    private static final String ACTION_DEPLOYGATE_STARTED = "com.deploygate.action.ServiceStarted";
049    private static final String DEPLOYGATE_PACKAGE = "com.deploygate";
050    private static final Object sPendingEventLock = new Object();
051
052    private static DeployGate sInstance;
053
054    private final Context mApplicationContext;
055    private final DeployGateClient mDeployGateClient;
056    private final HostApp mHostApp;
057    private final Handler mHandler;
058    private final ILogcatInstructionSerializer mLogcatInstructionSerializer;
059    private final CustomLogInstructionSerializer mCustomLogInstructionSerializer;
060    private final HashSet<DeployGateCallback> mCallbacks;
061    private final HashMap<String, Bundle> mPendingEvents;
062    private final String mExpectedAuthor;
063    private String mAuthor;
064
065    private CountDownLatch mInitializedLatch;
066    private boolean mIsDeployGateAvailable;
067
068    private boolean mAppIsManaged;
069    private boolean mAppIsAuthorized;
070    private boolean mAppIsStopRequested;
071    private String mLoginUsername;
072    private String mDistributionUserName;
073    private int mCurrentRevision;
074    private String mDistributionId;
075    private String mDistributionTitle;
076
077    private boolean mAppUpdateAvailable;
078    private int mAppUpdateRevision;
079    private String mAppUpdateVersionName;
080    private int mAppUpdateVersionCode;
081    private String mAppUpdateMessage;
082
083    private IDeployGateSdkService mRemoteService;
084
085    private final IDeployGateSdkServiceCallback mRemoteCallback = new IDeployGateSdkServiceCallback.Stub() {
086
087        public void onEvent(
088                String action,
089                Bundle extras
090        ) throws RemoteException {
091            if (TextUtils.isEmpty(action)) {
092                return;
093            }
094
095            // ensure non-null
096            extras = extras != null ? extras : new Bundle();
097
098            if (DeployGateEvent.ACTION_INIT.equals(action)) {
099                onInitialized(extras.getBoolean(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_IS_MANAGED, false), extras.getBoolean(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_IS_AUTHORIZED, false), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_LOGIN_USERNAME), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_DISTRIBUTION_USER_NAME), extras.getBoolean(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_IS_STOP_REQUESTED, false), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_AUTHOR), extras.getInt(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_CURRENT_REVISION, 0), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_CURRENT_DISTRIBUTION_ID), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_CURRENT_DISTRIBUTION_TITLE));
100            } else if (DeployGateEvent.ACTION_UPDATE_AVAILABLE.equals(action)) {
101                onUpdateArrived(extras.getInt(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_SERIAL), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_VERSION_NAME), extras.getInt(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_VERSION_CODE), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_SERIAL_MESSAGE));
102            } else if (DeployGateEvent.ACTION_ONESHOT_LOGCAT.equals(action)) {
103                String captureId = null;
104
105                if (mHostApp.canUseDeviceCapture() && mDeployGateClient.isSupported(Compatibility.DEVICE_CAPTURE)) {
106                    // still nullable
107                    captureId = extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_CAPTURE_ID);
108                }
109
110                onOneshotLogcat(captureId);
111            } else if (DeployGateEvent.ACTION_ENABLE_LOGCAT.equals(action)) {
112                if (mDeployGateClient.isSupported(Compatibility.STREAMED_LOGCAT)) {
113                    String sessionKey = extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_LOGCAT_STREAM_SESSION_KEY);
114
115                    if (TextUtils.isEmpty(sessionKey)) {
116                        Logger.w("%s is missing in the extra", DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_LOGCAT_STREAM_SESSION_KEY);
117                        return;
118                    }
119
120                    onEnableStreamedLogcat(sessionKey);
121                } else {
122                    Logger.w("streamed logcat is not supported");
123                }
124            } else if (DeployGateEvent.ACTION_DISABLE_LOGCAT.equals(action)) {
125                if (mDeployGateClient.isSupported(Compatibility.STREAMED_LOGCAT)) {
126                    onDisableStreamedLogcat();
127                } else {
128                    Logger.w("streamed logcat is not supported");
129                }
130            } else {
131                Logger.w("%s is not supported by this sdk version", action);
132            }
133        }
134
135        private void onInitialized(
136                final boolean isManaged,
137                final boolean isAuthorized,
138                final String loginUsername,
139                final String distributionUserName,
140                final boolean isStopped,
141                final String author,
142                int currentRevision,
143                String distributionId,
144                String distributionTitle
145        ) throws RemoteException {
146            Log.v(TAG, "DeployGate service initialized");
147            mAppIsManaged = isManaged;
148            mAppIsAuthorized = isAuthorized;
149            mAppIsStopRequested = isStopped;
150            mLoginUsername = loginUsername;
151            mDistributionUserName = distributionUserName;
152            mAuthor = author;
153            mCurrentRevision = currentRevision;
154            mDistributionId = distributionId;
155            mDistributionTitle = distributionTitle;
156
157            mHandler.post(new Runnable() {
158                @Override
159                public void run() {
160                    for (DeployGateCallback callback : mCallbacks) {
161                        callback.onInitialized(true);
162                        callback.onStatusChanged(isManaged, isAuthorized, loginUsername, isStopped);
163                    }
164                }
165            });
166
167            mIsDeployGateAvailable = true;
168
169            mCustomLogInstructionSerializer.setDisabled(false);
170            mCustomLogInstructionSerializer.connect(mRemoteService);
171            mLogcatInstructionSerializer.setEnabled(true);
172            mLogcatInstructionSerializer.connect(mRemoteService);
173
174            mInitializedLatch.countDown();
175
176            // to release a lock as soon as possible.
177            flushPendingEvents();
178        }
179
180        private void onUpdateArrived(
181                final int serial,
182                final String versionName,
183                final int versionCode,
184                final String message
185        ) throws RemoteException {
186            mAppUpdateAvailable = true;
187            mAppUpdateRevision = serial;
188            mAppUpdateVersionName = versionName;
189            mAppUpdateVersionCode = versionCode;
190            mAppUpdateMessage = message;
191
192            mHandler.post(new Runnable() {
193                @Override
194                public void run() {
195                    for (DeployGateCallback callback : mCallbacks) {
196                        callback.onUpdateAvailable(serial, versionName, versionCode);
197                    }
198                }
199            });
200        }
201    };
202
203    @SuppressWarnings("FieldCanBeLocal")
204    private final VisibilityLifecycleCallbacks.OnVisibilityChangeListener mOnVisibilityChangeListener = new VisibilityLifecycleCallbacks.OnVisibilityChangeListener() {
205
206        @Override
207        public void onForeground(
208                long elapsedRealtime,
209                TimeUnit timeUnit
210        ) {
211            Bundle extras = new Bundle();
212            extras.putLong(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_VISIBILITY_EVENT_ELAPSED_REAL_TIME_IN_NANOS, timeUnit.toNanos(elapsedRealtime));
213            extras.putInt(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_VISIBILITY_EVENT_TYPE, DeployGateEvent.VisibilityType.FOREGROUND);
214            invokeAction(DeployGateEvent.ACTION_VISIBILITY_EVENT, extras, true);
215        }
216
217        @Override
218        public void onBackground(
219                long elapsedRealtime,
220                TimeUnit timeUnit
221        ) {
222            Bundle extras = new Bundle();
223            extras.putLong(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_VISIBILITY_EVENT_ELAPSED_REAL_TIME_IN_NANOS, timeUnit.toNanos(elapsedRealtime));
224            extras.putInt(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_VISIBILITY_EVENT_TYPE, DeployGateEvent.VisibilityType.BACKGROUND);
225            invokeAction(DeployGateEvent.ACTION_VISIBILITY_EVENT, extras, true);
226        }
227    };
228
229    private void requestOneshotLogcat() {
230        onOneshotLogcat(null);
231    }
232
233    private void onOneshotLogcat(String captureId) {
234        mLogcatInstructionSerializer.requestOneshotLogcat(captureId);
235    }
236
237    private void onEnableStreamedLogcat(String streamSessionKey) {
238        if (TextUtils.isEmpty(streamSessionKey)) {
239            Logger.w("sdk-origin streamed logcat requests are forbidden");
240            return;
241        }
242
243        mLogcatInstructionSerializer.requestStreamedLogcat(streamSessionKey);
244    }
245
246    private void onDisableStreamedLogcat() {
247        mLogcatInstructionSerializer.stopStream();
248    }
249
250    void callbackDeployGateUnavailable() {
251        mHandler.post(new Runnable() {
252            @Override
253            public void run() {
254                for (DeployGateCallback callback : mCallbacks) {
255                    callback.onInitialized(false);
256                    callback.onStatusChanged(false, false, null, false);
257                }
258            }
259        });
260    }
261
262
263    /**
264     * Do not instantiate directly. Call {@link #install(Application)} on your
265     * {@link Application#onCreate()} instead.
266     */
267    private DeployGate(
268            Context applicationContext,
269            HostApp hostApp,
270            DeployGateSdkConfiguration sdkConfiguration
271    ) {
272        // Don't hold sdkConfiguration to avoid memory leak
273
274        mApplicationContext = applicationContext;
275        mDeployGateClient = new DeployGateClient(applicationContext, DEPLOYGATE_PACKAGE);
276        mHostApp = hostApp;
277        mHandler = new Handler();
278        mLogcatInstructionSerializer = mHostApp.canUseLogcat ? new LogcatInstructionSerializer(mHostApp.packageName) : ILogcatInstructionSerializer.NULL_INSTANCE;
279        mCustomLogInstructionSerializer = new CustomLogInstructionSerializer(mHostApp.packageName, sdkConfiguration.customLogConfiguration);
280        mCallbacks = new HashSet<>();
281        mPendingEvents = new HashMap<>();
282        mExpectedAuthor = sdkConfiguration.appOwnerName;
283
284        prepareBroadcastReceiver();
285
286        if (sdkConfiguration.callback != null) {
287            mCallbacks.add(sdkConfiguration.callback);
288        }
289
290        mInitializedLatch = new CountDownLatch(1);
291        ((Application) applicationContext).registerActivityLifecycleCallbacks(new VisibilityLifecycleCallbacks(mOnVisibilityChangeListener));
292        initService(true);
293    }
294
295    private boolean initService(boolean isBoot) {
296        if (mDeployGateClient.isInstalled) {
297            Log.v(TAG, "DeployGate installation detected. Initializing.");
298            bindToService(isBoot);
299            return true;
300        } else {
301            Log.v(TAG, "DeployGate is not available on this device.");
302            mCustomLogInstructionSerializer.setDisabled(true);
303            mLogcatInstructionSerializer.setEnabled(false);
304            mInitializedLatch.countDown();
305            mIsDeployGateAvailable = false;
306            callbackDeployGateUnavailable();
307            return false;
308        }
309    }
310
311    private void prepareBroadcastReceiver() {
312        IntentFilter filter = new IntentFilter(ACTION_DEPLOYGATE_STARTED);
313        BroadcastReceiver receiver = new BroadcastReceiver() {
314            @Override
315            public void onReceive(
316                    Context context,
317                    Intent intent
318            ) {
319                if (intent == null) {
320                    return;
321                }
322                if (mDeployGateClient.isInstalled) {
323                    bindToService(false);
324                }
325            }
326        };
327
328        if (Build.VERSION.SDK_INT >= Build.VERSION_CODES.TIRAMISU) {
329            mApplicationContext.registerReceiver(receiver, filter, Context.RECEIVER_EXPORTED);
330        } else {
331            mApplicationContext.registerReceiver(receiver, filter);
332        }
333    }
334
335    private void bindToService(final boolean isBoot) {
336        Intent service = new Intent(IDeployGateSdkService.class.getName());
337        service.setPackage(DEPLOYGATE_PACKAGE);
338        mApplicationContext.bindService(service, new ServiceConnection() {
339            public void onServiceConnected(
340                    ComponentName name,
341                    IBinder service
342            ) {
343                Log.v(TAG, "DeployGate service connected");
344                mRemoteService = IDeployGateSdkService.Stub.asInterface(service);
345                requestServiceInit(isBoot);
346            }
347
348            @Override
349            public void onServiceDisconnected(ComponentName name) {
350                Log.v(TAG, "DeployGate service disconneced");
351                mRemoteService = null;
352                mCustomLogInstructionSerializer.disconnect();
353                mLogcatInstructionSerializer.disconnect();
354            }
355        }, Context.BIND_AUTO_CREATE);
356    }
357
358    private void requestServiceInit(final boolean isBoot) {
359        Bundle args = new Bundle();
360        args.putBoolean(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_IS_BOOT, isBoot);
361        args.putBoolean(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_CAN_LOGCAT, mHostApp.canUseLogcat);
362        args.putString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_EXPECTED_AUTHOR, mExpectedAuthor);
363        args.putInt(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_SDK_VERSION, mHostApp.sdkVersion);
364        args.putString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_SDK_ARTIFACT_VERSION, mHostApp.sdkArtifactVersion);
365        args.putInt(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_ACTIVE_FEATURE_FLAGS, mHostApp.activeFeatureFlags);
366        try {
367            mRemoteService.init(mRemoteCallback, mHostApp.packageName, args);
368        } catch (RemoteException e) {
369            Log.w(TAG, "DeployGate service failed to be initialized.");
370        }
371    }
372
373    /**
374     * Send an event to the client application
375     *
376     * @param action
377     *         to be sent
378     * @param extras
379     *         to be sent
380     * @param allowPending
381     *         Allow queueing events to send them after a service connection is established (since 4.6.0)
382     */
383    private void invokeAction(
384            String action,
385            Bundle extras,
386            boolean allowPending
387    ) {
388        extras = extras != null ? extras : new Bundle();
389
390        if (mRemoteService == null) {
391            if (allowPending) {
392                synchronized (sPendingEventLock) {
393                    mPendingEvents.put(action, extras);
394                }
395            }
396
397            return;
398        }
399        try {
400            mRemoteService.sendEvent(mHostApp.packageName, action, extras);
401        } catch (RemoteException e) {
402            Log.w(TAG, "failed to invoke " + action + " action: " + e.getMessage());
403        }
404    }
405
406    private void flushPendingEvents() {
407        // cannot re-enqueue events for now
408        synchronized (sPendingEventLock) {
409            Iterator<Map.Entry<String, Bundle>> iterator = mPendingEvents.entrySet().iterator();
410
411            while (iterator.hasNext()) {
412                Map.Entry<String, Bundle> entry = iterator.next();
413                invokeAction(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue(), false);
414                iterator.remove();
415            }
416        }
417    }
418
419    /**
420     * Clear the initiated DeployGate instance.
421     * <p>
422     * This method is only for testing so breaking changes would may happen.
423     */
424    static void clear() {
425        sInstance = null;
426    }
427
428
429    /**
430     * Install DeployGate on your application instance. Call this method inside
431     * of your {@link Application#onCreate()}, in ContentProvider or AndroidX Startup Initializer only once.
432     *
433     * @param context Your application's Context. SDK will use {@code context.getApplicationContext} and don't hold this object reference.
434     * @param sdkConfiguration sdk configuration {@link DeployGateSdkConfiguration}
435     *
436     * @throws IllegalStateException
437     *         if this called twice
438     * @since 4.7.0
439     */
440
441    public static void install(Context context, DeployGateSdkConfiguration sdkConfiguration) {
442        if (sInstance != null) {
443            Log.w(TAG, "DeployGate.install was already called. Ignoring.");
444            return;
445        }
446
447        Context application = context.getApplicationContext();
448
449        HostApp hostApp = new HostApp(
450                application,
451                sdkConfiguration
452        );
453
454        if (!hostApp.isSdkEnabled) {
455            return;
456        }
457
458        if (sdkConfiguration.isCrashReportingEnabled) {
459            Thread.setDefaultUncaughtExceptionHandler(new DeployGateUncaughtExceptionHandler(Thread.getDefaultUncaughtExceptionHandler()));
460        } else {
461            Logger.d("DeployGateSDK crash reporting hasn't started");
462        }
463
464        sInstance = new DeployGate(
465                application,
466                hostApp,
467                sdkConfiguration
468        );
469    }
470
471    /**
472     * Install DeployGate on your application instance. Call this method inside
473     * of your {@link Application#onCreate()} once.
474     * <p>
475     * On a release build, which has <code>android:isDebuggable</code> set false on
476     * AndroidManifest.xml, this function will do nothing. If you want to enable
477     * DeployGate on a release build, consider using
478     * {@link #install(Application, String, DeployGateCallback, boolean)}
479     * instead.
480     * </p>
481     * <p>
482     * <b>Note:</b> To make {@link #isAuthorized()} more effective, you should
483     * call {@link #install(Application, String)} instead and specify authorId
484     * explicitly to ensure the authority of this app to prevent casual
485     * redistribution via DeployGate.
486     * </p>
487     *
488     * @param app
489     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
490     *
491     * @throws IllegalStateException
492     *         if this called twice
493     * @since r1
494     * @deprecated since 4.7.0. Use {@link DeployGate#install(Context, DeployGateSdkConfiguration)} instead.
495     */
496    public static void install(Application app) {
497        install(app, (String) null);
498    }
499
500    /**
501     * Install DeployGate on your application instance. Call this method inside
502     * of your {@link Application#onCreate()} once.
503     * <p>
504     * On a release build, which has <code>android:isDebuggable</code> set false on
505     * AndroidManifest.xml, this function will do nothing. If you want to enable
506     * DeployGate on a release build, consider using
507     * {@link #install(Application, String, DeployGateCallback, boolean)}
508     * instead.
509     * </p>
510     *
511     * @param app
512     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
513     * @param author
514     *         author username of this app.
515     *
516     * @throws IllegalStateException
517     *         if this called twice
518     * @since r2
519     * @deprecated since 4.7.0. Use {@link DeployGate#install(Context, DeployGateSdkConfiguration)} instead.
520     */
521    public static void install(
522            Application app,
523            String author
524    ) {
525        install(app, author, null);
526    }
527
528    /**
529     * Install DeployGate on your application instance and register a callback
530     * listener. Call this method inside of your {@link Application#onCreate()}
531     * once.
532     * <p>
533     * On a release build, which has <code>android:isDebuggable</code> set false on
534     * AndroidManifest.xml, this function will do nothing. If you want to enable
535     * DeployGate on a release build, consider using
536     * {@link #install(Application, String, DeployGateCallback, boolean)}
537     * instead.
538     * </p>
539     * <p>
540     * <b>Note:</b> To make {@link #isAuthorized()} more effective, you should
541     * call {@link #install(Application, String)} instead and specify authorId
542     * explicitly to ensure the authority of this app to prevent casual
543     * redistribution via DeployGate.
544     * </p>
545     *
546     * @param app
547     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
548     * @param callback
549     *         Callback interface to listen events.
550     *
551     * @throws IllegalStateException
552     *         if this called twice
553     * @since r1
554     * @deprecated since 4.7.0. Use {@link DeployGate#install(Context, DeployGateSdkConfiguration)} instead.
555     */
556    public static void install(
557            Application app,
558            DeployGateCallback callback
559    ) {
560        install(app, null, callback);
561    }
562
563    /**
564     * Install DeployGate on your application instance and register a callback
565     * listener. Call this method inside of your {@link Application#onCreate()}
566     * once.
567     * <p>
568     * <b>Note:</b> To make {@link #isAuthorized()} more effective, you should
569     * call {@link #install(Application, String)} instead and specify authorId
570     * explicitly to ensure the authority of this app to prevent casual
571     * redistribution via DeployGate.
572     * </p>
573     *
574     * @param app
575     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
576     * @param forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
577     *         if you want to keep DeployGate alive on
578     *         the release build, set this true.
579     *
580     * @throws IllegalStateException
581     *         if this called twice
582     * @since r4.2
583     * @deprecated since 4.7.0. Use {@link DeployGate#install(Context, DeployGateSdkConfiguration)} instead.
584     */
585    public static void install(
586            Application app,
587            boolean forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
588    ) {
589        install(app, null, null, forceApplyOnReleaseBuild);
590    }
591
592    /**
593     * Install DeployGate on your application instance and register a callback
594     * listener. Call this method inside of your {@link Application#onCreate()}
595     * once.
596     * <p>
597     * On a release build, which has <code>android:isDebuggable</code> set false on
598     * AndroidManifest.xml, this function will do nothing. If you want to enable
599     * DeployGate on a release build, consider using
600     * {@link #install(Application, String, DeployGateCallback, boolean)}
601     * instead.
602     * </p>
603     *
604     * @param app
605     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
606     * @param author
607     *         author username of this app.
608     * @param callback
609     *         Callback interface to listen events.
610     *
611     * @throws IllegalStateException
612     *         if this called twice
613     * @since r2
614     * @deprecated since 4.7.0. Use {@link DeployGate#install(Context, DeployGateSdkConfiguration)} instead.
615     */
616    public static void install(
617            Application app,
618            String author,
619            DeployGateCallback callback
620    ) {
621        install(app, author, callback, false);
622    }
623
624    /**
625     * Install DeployGate on your application instance and register a callback
626     * listener. Call this method inside of your {@link Application#onCreate()}
627     * once.
628     * <p>
629     * <b>Note:</b> To make {@link #isAuthorized()} more effective, you should
630     * call {@link #install(Application, String)} instead and specify authorId
631     * explicitly to ensure the authority of this app to prevent casual
632     * redistribution via DeployGate.
633     * </p>
634     *
635     * @param app
636     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
637     * @param callback
638     *         Callback interface to listen events. Can be null.
639     * @param forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
640     *         if you want to keep DeployGate alive on
641     *         the release build, set this true.
642     *
643     * @throws IllegalStateException
644     *         if this called twice
645     * @since r1
646     * @deprecated since 4.7.0. Use {@link DeployGate#install(Context, DeployGateSdkConfiguration)} instead.
647     */
648    public static void install(
649            Application app,
650            DeployGateCallback callback,
651            boolean forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
652    ) {
653        install(app, null, callback, forceApplyOnReleaseBuild);
654    }
655
656    /**
657     * Install DeployGate on your application instance and register a callback
658     * listener. Call this method inside of your {@link Application#onCreate()}
659     * once.
660     *
661     * @param app
662     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
663     * @param author
664     *         author username of this app. Can be null.
665     * @param callback
666     *         Callback interface to listen events. Can be null.
667     * @param forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
668     *         if you want to keep DeployGate alive on
669     *         the release build, set this true.
670     *
671     * @since r2
672     * @deprecated since 4.7.0. Use {@link DeployGate#install(Context, DeployGateSdkConfiguration)} instead.
673     */
674    public static void install(
675            Application app,
676            String author,
677            DeployGateCallback callback,
678            boolean forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
679    ) {
680        install(app, author, callback, forceApplyOnReleaseBuild, new CustomLogConfiguration.Builder().build());
681    }
682
683    /**
684     * Install DeployGate on your application instance and register a callback
685     * listener. Call this method inside of your {@link Application#onCreate()}
686     * once.
687     *
688     * @param app
689     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
690     * @param author
691     *         author username of this app. Can be null.
692     * @param callback
693     *         Callback interface to listen events. Can be null.
694     * @param forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
695     *         if you want to keep DeployGate alive on
696     *         the release build, set this true.
697     * @param customLogConfiguration
698     *         set a configuration for custom logging
699     *
700     * @since 4.4.0
701     * @deprecated since 4.7.0. Use {@link DeployGate#install(Context, DeployGateSdkConfiguration)} instead.
702     */
703    public static void install(
704            Application app,
705            String author,
706            DeployGateCallback callback,
707            boolean forceApplyOnReleaseBuild,
708            CustomLogConfiguration customLogConfiguration
709    ) {
710        install(
711                app,
712                new DeployGateSdkConfiguration.Builder()
713                        .setAppOwnerName(author)
714                        .setCustomLogConfiguration(customLogConfiguration)
715                        .setEnabledOnNonDebuggableBuild(forceApplyOnReleaseBuild)
716                        .setCallback(callback)
717                        .build()
718        );
719    }
720
721    /**
722     * Request refreshing cached session values (e.g., isAuthorized, etc.) to
723     * the DeployGate service. Nothing happens if this called before
724     * {@link #install(Application)} or when refreshing is already in progress.
725     * Note that after calling this, {@link #isInitialized()} will changed to
726     * false immediately and any call to <code>is*()</code> will be blocked until
727     * refreshing get finished.
728     *
729     * @since r1
730     */
731    public static void refresh() {
732        if (sInstance != null) {
733            sInstance.refreshInternal();
734        }
735    }
736
737    private void refreshInternal() {
738        if (mInitializedLatch.getCount() == 0) {
739            mInitializedLatch = new CountDownLatch(1);
740            if (mRemoteService == null) {
741                initService(false);
742            } else {
743                requestServiceInit(false);
744            }
745        }
746    }
747
748    /**
749     * Register a DeployGate event callback listener. Don't forget to call
750     * {@link #unregisterCallback(DeployGateCallback)} when the callback is no
751     * longer needed (e.g., on destroying an activity.) If the listener has
752     * already in the callback list, just ignored.
753     *
754     * @param listener
755     *         callback listener
756     * @param refreshImmediately
757     *         if you want to receive current states, set this
758     *         true.
759     *
760     * @since r1
761     */
762    public static void registerCallback(
763            DeployGateCallback listener,
764            boolean refreshImmediately
765    ) {
766        if (sInstance == null) {
767            return;
768        }
769        if (listener == null) {
770            return;
771        }
772
773        sInstance.registerCallbackInternal(listener, refreshImmediately);
774    }
775
776    private void registerCallbackInternal(
777            DeployGateCallback listener,
778            boolean callbackImmediately
779    ) {
780        mCallbacks.add(listener);
781        if (callbackImmediately) {
782            refresh();
783        }
784    }
785
786    /**
787     * Unregister a callback listener. If the listener was not registered, just
788     * ignored.
789     *
790     * @param listener
791     *         callback listener to be removed
792     *
793     * @since r1
794     */
795    public static void unregisterCallback(DeployGateCallback listener) {
796        if (sInstance == null) {
797            return;
798        }
799        if (listener == null) {
800            return;
801        }
802
803        sInstance.mCallbacks.remove(listener);
804    }
805
806    /**
807     * Get whether SDK is completed its intialization process and ready after
808     * {@link #install(Application)}. This call will never blocked.
809     *
810     * @return true if SDK is ready. false otherwise. If no install() called
811     * ever, this always returns false.
812     *
813     * @since r1
814     */
815    public static boolean isInitialized() {
816        if (sInstance != null) {
817            return sInstance.mInitializedLatch.getCount() == 0;
818        }
819        return false;
820    }
821
822    /**
823     * Get whether DeployGate client service is available on this device.
824     * <p>
825     * Note this function will block until SDK get ready after
826     * {@link #install(Application)} called. So if you want to call this
827     * function from the main thread, you should confirm that
828     * {@link #isInitialized()} is true before calling this. (Or consider using
829     * {@link DeployGateCallback#onInitialized(boolean)} callback.)
830     * </p>
831     *
832     * @return true if valid DeployGate client is available. false otherwise. If
833     * no install() called ever, this always returns false.
834     *
835     * @since r1
836     */
837    public static boolean isDeployGateAvaliable() {
838        if (sInstance != null) {
839            waitForInitialized();
840            return sInstance.mIsDeployGateAvailable;
841        }
842        return false;
843    }
844
845    /**
846     * Get whether this application and its package is known and managed under
847     * the DeployGate.
848     * <p>
849     * Note this function will block until SDK get ready after
850     * {@link #install(Application)} called. So if you want to call this
851     * function from the main thread, you should confirm that
852     * {@link #isInitialized()} is true before calling this. (Or consider using
853     * {@link DeployGateCallback#onInitialized(boolean)} callback.)
854     * </p>
855     *
856     * @return true if DeployGate knows and manages this package. false
857     * otherwise. If no install() called ever, this always returns
858     * false.
859     *
860     * @since r1
861     */
862    public static boolean isManaged() {
863        if (sInstance != null) {
864            waitForInitialized();
865            return sInstance.mAppIsManaged;
866        }
867        return false;
868    }
869
870    /**
871     * Get whether current DeployGate user has this application in his/her
872     * available list. You may want to check this value on initialization
873     * process of the main activity if you want to limit user of this
874     * application to only who you explicitly allowed.
875     * <p>
876     * Note this function will block until SDK get ready after
877     * {@link #install(Application)} called. So if you want to call this
878     * function from the main thread, you should confirm that
879     * {@link #isInitialized()} is true before calling this. (Or consider using
880     * {@link DeployGateCallback#onInitialized(boolean)} callback.)
881     * </p>
882     *
883     * @return true if current DeployGate user has available list which contains
884     * this application. false otherwise. If no install() called ever,
885     * this always returns false.
886     *
887     * @since r1
888     */
889    public static boolean isAuthorized() {
890        if (sInstance != null) {
891            waitForInitialized();
892            return sInstance.mAppIsAuthorized;
893        }
894        return false;
895    }

898     * Get current DeployGate username. This function only available when
899     * {@link #isAuthorized()} is true.
900     * <p>

904     * {@link #isInitialized()} is true before calling this. (Or consider using
905     * {@link DeployGateCallback#onInitialized(boolean)} callback.)
906     * </p>

909     *

912    public static String getLoginUsername() {

914            waitForInitialized();
915            return sInstance.mLoginUsername;
916        }
917        return null;
918    }

920    /**
921     * Get current app's author (e.g., User or Organzation) name on DeployGate. You
922     * may use this value to check the app was distributed by yourself or
923     * someone else.
924     * <p>
925     * <b>Tip:</b> If you want to prevent distributing your app by someone else
926     * on the DeployGate, consider using {@link #install(Application, String)}.
927     * </p>
928     * <p>

930     * {@link #install(Application)} called. So if you want to call this
931     * function from the main thread, you should confirm that
932     * {@link #isInitialized()} is true before calling this. (Or consider using
933     * {@link DeployGateCallback#onInitialized(boolean)} callback.)
934     * </p>

937     *
938     * @since r2
939     */

948    /**

1034    @SuppressWarnings("unused")
1035    private/* public */ static boolean isStopRequested() {
1036        if (sInstance != null) {
1037            waitForInitialized();
1038            return sInstance.mAppIsStopRequested;
1039        }
1040        return false;
1041    }
1042
1043    private static void waitForInitialized() {
1044        try {
1045            sInstance.mInitializedLatch.await();
1046        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1047            Log.w(TAG, "Interrupted while waiting initialization");
1048        }
1049    }
1050
1051    static DeployGate getInstance() {
1052        return sInstance;
1053    }
1054
1055    void sendCrashReport(/* non-null */ Throwable ex) {
1056        if (mRemoteService == null) {
1057            return;
1058        }
1059
1060        Bundle extras = new Bundle();
1061        try {
1062            if (mDeployGateClient.isSupported(Compatibility.SERIALIZED_EXCEPTION)) {
1063                Throwable rootCause = getRootCause(ex);
1064                String msg = rootCause.getMessage();
1065                extras.putString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_EXCEPTION_ROOT_CAUSE_CLASSNAME, rootCause.getClass().getName());
1066                extras.putString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_EXCEPTION_ROOT_CAUSE_MESSAGE, msg != null ? msg : "");
1067                extras.putString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_EXCEPTION_STACKTRACES, Log.getStackTraceString(ex));
1068            } else {
1069                extras.putSerializable(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_EXCEPTION, ex);
1070            }
1071
1072            mRemoteService.sendEvent(mHostApp.packageName, DeployGateEvent.ACTION_SEND_CRASH_REPORT, extras);
1073        } catch (RemoteException e) {
1074            Log.w(TAG, "failed to send crash report: " + e.getMessage());
1075        }
1076    }
1077
1078    /* non-null */
1079    private static Throwable getRootCause(/* non-null */ Throwable ex) {
1080        Throwable cause = ex;
1081        LinkedList<Throwable> throwables = new LinkedList<>();
1082
1083        while (cause != null && !throwables.contains(cause)) {
1084            throwables.add(cause);
1085            cause = cause.getCause();
1086        }
1087
1088        return throwables.getLast();
1089    }
1090
1091    void sendLog(
1092            String type,
1093            String body
1094    ) {
1095        mCustomLogInstructionSerializer.requestSendingLog(new CustomLog(type, body));
1096    }
1097
1098    static boolean isFeatureSupported(Compatibility compatibility) {
1099        if (sInstance == null) {
1100            return false;
1101        }
1102
1103        return sInstance.mDeployGateClient.isSupported(compatibility);
1104    }

1106    /**
1107     * Capture current LogCat and send it. This call will work asynchronously.
1108     * Capturing LogCat requires <code>android.permission.READ_LOGS</code> is
1109     * declared on your app AndroidManifest.xml, or your app is running on
1110     * Android 4.1 or higher. If LogCat is not available, this function simply
1111     * does nothing.
1112     *
1113     * @since r3
1114     */
1115    public static void requestLogCat() {
1116        if (sInstance != null) {
1117            sInstance.requestOneshotLogcat();
1118        }
1119    }

1122    /**
1123     * Returns the revision of the app on DeployGate.
1124     * The revision number is automatically incremented integer value every time you upload a build to DeployGate,
1125     * so you can identify the build explicitly.
1126     * <p>
1127     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function always returns 0.
1128     *
1129     * @return revision number of the app, or 0 if DeployGate is older than v1.7.0 (39)
1130     *
1131     * @since r4
1132     */
1133    public static int getCurrentRevision() {
1134        if (sInstance != null) {
1135            return sInstance.mCurrentRevision;
1136        }
1137        return 0;
1138    }
1139
1140    /**
1141     * Returns the URL of the distribution if the app was installed through Distribution Page.
1142     * <p>
1143     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function always returns null.
1144     *
1145     * @return URL of the distribution page, null if the app was not installed through Distribution Page or DeployGate is older than v1.7.0 (39)
1146     *
1147     * @since r4
1148     */
1149    public static String getDistributionUrl() {
1150        if (sInstance == null) {
1151            return null;
1152        }
1153
1154        if (TextUtils.isEmpty(sInstance.mDistributionId)) {
1155            return null;
1156        }
1157
1158        return "https://deploygate.com/distributions/" + sInstance.mDistributionId;
1159    }
1160
1161    /**
1162     * Returns the ID (40 digits hex string appears in URL) of the distribution if the app was installed through Distribution Page.
1163     * <p>
1164     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function always returns null.
1165     *
1166     * @return ID of the distribution page, null if the app was not installed through Distribution Page or DeployGate is older than v1.7.0 (39)
1167     *
1168     * @since r4
1169     */
1170    public static String getDistributionId() {
1171        if (sInstance == null) {
1172            return null;
1173        }
1174
1175        if (TextUtils.isEmpty(sInstance.mDistributionId)) {
1176            return null;
1177        }
1178
1179        return sInstance.mDistributionId;
1180    }
1181
1182    /**
1183     * Returns the title of the distribution if the app was installed through Distribution Page.
1184     * <p>
1185     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function always returns null.
1186     *
1187     * @return Title of the distribution page, null if the app was not installed through Distribution Page or DeployGate is older than v1.7.0 (39)
1188     *
1189     * @since r4
1190     */
1191    public static String getDistributionTitle() {
1192        if (sInstance == null) {
1193            return null;
1194        }
1195
1196        if (TextUtils.isEmpty(sInstance.mDistributionTitle)) {
1197            return null;
1198        }
1199
1200        return sInstance.mDistributionTitle;
1201    }

1242            return false;

1293    /**
1294     * Returns the message attached to the build.
1295     * If the app was installed via Distribution Page (i.e. {@link #getDistributionUrl() is not null,}
1296     * this method returns Release Note that was entered when you published a new version on the page.
1297     * Otherwise this method returns the message that was entered when you upload a new build to DeployGate.
1298     * <p>
1299     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function always returns null.
1300     *
1301     * @return The message attached to the build
1302     *
1303     * @since r4
1304     */
1305    public static String getUpdateMessage() {
1306        if (sInstance == null || !isFeatureSupported(Compatibility.UPDATE_MESSAGE_OF_BUILD)) {
1307            return null;
1308        }
1309
1310        return sInstance.mAppUpdateMessage;
1311    }

1313    /**
1314     * Start the installation of the latest version of the app if available. No effects if there's no update.
1315     * <p>
1316     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function produces no effect.
1317     *
1318     * @since r4
1319     */
1320    public static void installUpdate() {
1321        if (sInstance == null) {
1322            return;
1323        }
1324
1325        sInstance.invokeAction(DeployGateEvent.ACTION_INSTALL_UPDATE, null, false);
1326    }
1327
1328    /**
1329     * Open comments screen for the distribution of the app installed.
1330     * No effect if the app was installed via Distribution Page (i.e. {@link #getDistributionUrl() is null.}
1331     * <p>
1332     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function produces no effect.
1333     *
1334     * @since r4
1335     */
1336    public static void openComments() {
1337        if (sInstance == null || sInstance.mDistributionId == null) {
1338            return;
1339        }
1340
1341        sInstance.invokeAction(DeployGateEvent.ACTION_OPEN_COMMENTS, null, false);
1342    }
1343
1344    /**
1345     * Open comment composer screen for the distribution of the app installed.
1346     * No effect if the app was installed via Distribution Page (i.e. {@link #getDistributionUrl() is null.}
1347     * <p>
1348     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function produces no effect.
1349     *
1350     * @since r4
1351     */
1352    public static void composeComment() {
1353        composeComment(null);
1354    }
1355
1356    /**
1357     * Open comment composer screen for the distribution of the app installed with pre filled string.
1358     * No effect if the app was installed via Distribution Page (i.e. {@link #getDistributionUrl() is null.}
1359     * <p>
1360     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function produces no effect.
1361     *
1362     * @param defaultComment
1363     *         Default comment set to the editor
1364     *
1365     * @since r4
1366     */
1367    public static void composeComment(String defaultComment) {
1368        if (sInstance == null || sInstance.mDistributionId == null) {
1369            return;
1370        }
1371
1372        Bundle extras = new Bundle();
1373        extras.putString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_COMMENT, defaultComment);
1374        sInstance.invokeAction(DeployGateEvent.ACTION_COMPOSE_COMMENT, extras, false);
1375    }

1378     * Get current user's name on Distribution Page. Default name is randomly generated string (like "[abcd1234]").
1379     * <p>
1380     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function returns null.
1381     *
1382     * @return User's display name on DeployGate. May be null.
1383     *
1384     * @since r4
1385     */
1386    public static String getDistributionUserName() {
1387        if (sInstance == null) {
1388            return null;
1389        }
1390
1391        return sInstance.mDistributionUserName;
1392    }
